intro: Leucospermum wittebergense, commonly known as the Witteberg fireblow, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its striking, orange-red flower heads that resemble flames. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are evergreen. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to Mediterranean climates.
